snippet.title: Keynote — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Keynote" by Ton Roosendaal, Francesco Siddi at Blender Conference 2025

The traditional opening of Blender Conference.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Compositing 5.0: Powerful yet Simple — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Compositing 5.0: Powerful yet Simple" by Habib Gahbiche at Blender Conference 2025

Many new features in the compositor are making compositing in Blender more powerful. In this talk, Habib will showcase these new features in the compositor and talk about the challenges of designing features for power users while keeping the experience simple for more casual VFX artists. He will also share the compositor roadmap and explain how the community can help shape the future of compositing in Blender.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Inside Blue Zoo's R&D: Building a Digital-First Toolkit in Blender — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Inside Blue Zoo's R&D: Building a Digital-First Toolkit in Blender" by Dane Winn, Vasil Shotarov, Joshua Palfrey at Blender Conference 2025

Join Blue Zoo for a look inside ZooKit, our powerful toolkit for Blender. We're building a workflow where a single artist or small team can take an idea from design to final render. This talk explores how we use Geometry Nodes and Rigify for character creation, world-building, and look development. We'll share our R&D process, from a universal character creator to procedural environments, offering a practical look at the challenges and breakthroughs shaping our digital-first pipeline and empowering artists to do more with less.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Slow Crafting VR: Hand-Drawn Textures and Worlds — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Slow Crafting VR: Hand-Drawn Textures and Worlds" by Beatriz Ruthes at Blender Conference 2025

In this talk, Beatriz Ruthes shares her process of building a VR environment entirely in Blender, in which every object and texture originates from hand-drawn illustrations on paper. Developed during an experimental artist residency in Luxembourg, the project explores how traditional techniques can bring warmth, intimacy and emotional resonance to digital spaces.
She walks through her workflow, from digitizing drawings to modeling, texturing, testing scale and atmosphere using Blender's VR add-on, while reflecting on how creative limitations shaped the project's visual language.
The presentation also addresses the experience of working independently with minimal resources and how artisanal processes can coexist with immersive technologies to create uniquely personal virtual worlds.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Blue Prince : Beyond The Doors — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Blue Prince : Beyond The Doors" by Davide Pellino at Blender Conference 2025

Davide Pellino, Art Director at Dogubomb
Blue Prince is a groundbreaking roguelike-puzzle game that launched in April 2025 as the highest-rated game of the year on Metacritic, scoring an outstanding 93/100 and emerging as a top Game of the Year contender. Celebrated for its scale and depth, it has drawn players into 100+ hours of gameplay. Yet one of its greatest secrets remains: every room and its iconic stylized visuals were created in Blender using just one shader and four textures.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: The Future of Extended Reality for Development — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"The Future of Extended Reality for Development" by Hogan Mastanduno, Jonas Holzman, Ruoya Sheng at Blender Conference 2025

PICO is collaborating with Blender to bring Extended Reality (XR) into the heart of the Blender ecosystem. 

In this talk, we explore the evolution of XR support in Blender, examine the current capabilities and limitations, and share our vision for how XR can transform Blender workflows—making them more immersive, intuitive, and spatially aware.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Exploring how creativity is built across industries — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Exploring how creativity is built across industries" by Filip Gladis at Blender Conference 2025

Mangoshake studio - from architecture and design to storytelling and visual effects.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Accessible Automated Pipelines for Small Teams — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Accessible Automated Pipelines for Small Teams" by Gregorio Guirado at Blender Conference 2025

This session explores how Blender became the core of a scalable VFX pipeline for a 2D animated feature. We’ll cover how a three-person team automated drop shadows, compositing setups, and cross-software integration across ~800 scenes—while tracking everything through custom spreadsheets and Flamenco. Real production numbers, working tools, scene studies and simple scripting approaches will be shared to help freelancers and small teams build efficient pipelines without deep programming knowledge.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Simulation and Visualisation of Optical Systems — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Simulation and Visualisation of Optical Systems" by Johannes Hinrichs at Blender Conference 2025

The design of imaging optical systems, like camera lenses, currently relies on a few specialized optical design software.
High cost of such software, the lack of certain features, and new demands in virtual production have created an interest to integrate 3D-software into optical design workflows.
In this talk, I will describe some of the requirements of lens design, demonstrate the rendering of a modeled camera lens in Blender, and discuss possible applications.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: From Solo Artist to Studio with Blender — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"From Solo Artist to Studio with Blender" by Mia Connolly at Blender Conference 2025

How a small group of artists and animators left Maya behind and built an indie studio from the ground up. This session will walk you through the real-world roadmap, how we built our pipeline, the lessons we learned, and how we did it all for under $1,000.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Facial Rigging for Stylized Character Animation — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Facial Rigging for Stylized Character Animation" by Rik Schutte at Blender Conference 2025

At Blender studio, we're developing a new Character Asset: Storm. This session will be a walkthrough on how I've explored different ways of facial rigging for a stylized character and why I chose to do it this particular way. The class will highlight the wants and needs from the animator and how this applies to the facial rig setup. We'll go over the facial step by step by looking at the mouth, eyes, cheeks and eyebrows and explain the workflow and tooling for creating these setups. Each one of these has their unique approach and features provided for the animator in order to conviently work with it.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Bringing concepts to life - Framestore's Visual Development — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Bringing concepts to life - Framestore's Visual Development" by Stefan Mayr, Juan Francisco Hernández Mendoza at Blender Conference 2025

How Framestore's Visual Development Department is integrating Blender in their workflow to create high quality Creature and Environment concepts

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Funny Legs: a 2D show by a 3D animator — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Funny Legs: a 2D show by a 3D animator" by Yana Zavialova at Blender Conference 2025

Funny Legs is an animated show on YouTube created entirely by one person, from modeling to render. In this talk, a 3D animator, Yana Zavialova, will tell how she has built an efficient pipeline that allows her to create a 1-minute episode in 2–3 weeks. She will share the Blender tricks (like rigging the color, using no lights in the scene, and mixing 3D with Grease Pencil) that helped to achieve an old-school 2D cartoon look.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: The development story of "Story Tools" — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"The development story of "Story Tools"" by Falk David, Pablo Fournier at Blender Conference 2025

The "Story Tools" project is aimed at improving existing functionality in Blender for crafting stories. Specifically, the goal is to improve storyboarding and layout workflows, working with multiple scenes and cameras, and managing shot continuity.
This presentation will give a quick rundown of the history behind the project, the current development status, and finally a demonstration of how it's been used already.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Custom Particle Systems in Geometry Nodes — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Custom Particle Systems in Geometry Nodes" by Kris Meeusen at Blender Conference 2025

With the introduction of simulation nodes, many popular physics systems can now be created directly within Geometry Nodes. One of the easiest and most enjoyable systems to start with is a particle system. Once you understand the basics, it becomes a lot of fun to creatively bend the laws of physics.
Check out an example here:
https://www.instagram.com/p/C6gCYfYt_pQ/

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Revolutionizing Virtual Production Car Process with Blender — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Revolutionizing Virtual Production Car Process with Blender" by Mike Hodgetts at Blender Conference 2025

This presentation will look at the ways in which Sim-Plates is changing the way that car process is shot for virtual production. 

Car Process is the method of shooting driving scenes against an LED Wall/Volume or green screen, which is traditionally done with captured plates. Sim-Plates.com create all our plates in 3D using Blender, which has several advantages over traditionally shot plates. 

In this talk Mike will cover the advantages of CG driving plates and look at some of the techniques that Sim-Plates use in Blender to create them.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Blender JAM – A Collective Animation Experiment — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Blender JAM – A Collective Animation Experiment" by Eli Rabinovich at Blender Conference 2025

Blender JAM is back at BCON! This fast-paced, collaborative event challenges you to create a 1-second animation in Blender. You'll get a pre-rigged character and a unique creative constraint based on a shared theme, all under a tight time limit.
It's about pushing animation instincts, embracing creativity under pressure, and having a fun, high-energy, hands-on experience with fellow artists.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Step Inside the Viewport: CATWALK’s VR-Driven Production Workflow — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Step Inside the Viewport: CATWALK’s VR-Driven Production Workflow" by Toni Mortero, Lidia Luna at Blender Conference 2025

Discover what it could be like to work inside Blender’s 3D viewport using a VR headset and 6DOF input.

The CATWALK project (Suzanne Awards Best Design winner, BCON24) will showcase its hybrid pipeline combining 3D, 2D, and VR techniques—and how it has contributed to making the VR experience a reality within our favorite 3D framework, using Grease Pencil-VR.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Integrating Blender into the manufacturing industry — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Integrating Blender into the manufacturing industry" by Jean-Christophe LEDUCQ at Blender Conference 2025

The presentation shows how Blender is integrated into Renault Group’s digital ecosystem, featuring full vehicle configuration, collaborative editing, and seamless connection to tools like Autodesk VRED.
It also highlights future opportunities for broader interoperability and collaboration.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: SkySplat Tutorial: From drone video to photo-realistic 3D scene — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"SkySplat Tutorial: From drone video to photo-realistic 3D scene" by Kyle Johnson at Blender Conference 2025

This tutorial covers the full process of turning low-cost drone footage into a photo-realistic 3D scene in Blender using SkySplat, a free and open-source addon. I’ll walk through frame extraction, COLMAP Structure-from-Motion, scene alignment in Blender, and 3D Gaussian Splat generation, done entirely within the Blender viewport.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Case Study on Spiritquest — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Case Study on Spiritquest" by Timo Berg, Iris Burkhardt, Valentin Dorian Schlie, Lukas Kuhn, Automne Ritzel at Blender Conference 2025

Case study of how we transitioned from Maya to Blender, and used, learned and implemented everything we found in the Blender toolbox to create our own unique style for "Spiritquest"

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Squishy Volumes at Your Fingertips — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Squishy Volumes at Your Fingertips" by Lars Helge Scheel at Blender Conference 2025

The Material Point Method (MPM) is a powerful technique for physical simulations, combining elastic, rigid, sand, and fluid objects. Over the past decade, it has become an important tool for VFX. Houdini and Maya already support it. In this talk, you will get an intuitive explanation of how MPM works and a showcase of a work-in-progress extension written in Rust that integrates MPM into Blender.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: The Future of Rendering — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"The Future of Rendering" by Jules Urbach at Blender Conference 2025

Join Jules Urbach as he presents his vision for the future of GPU- and AI-driven rendering and how it will impact gaming, visual effects, media, design, and art into the 2030s and beyond.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: From Comics to Animated Films: Bringing a Graphic Novel to Life—Solo! — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"From Comics to Animated Films: Bringing a Graphic Novel to Life—Solo!" by Dirk I. Tiede at Blender Conference 2025

Graphic novelist Dirk I. Tiede shares how he single-handedly adapted his comic series Paradigm Shift into an animated short film. He demonstrates the challenges of creating character rigs (including a fully transformable werewolf rig!), using comics as storyboards, recreating his illustrative style using EEVEE and Grease Pencil, and ultimately bringing it all together to bring the comic to life!

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: An Automation Pipeline for Robotics and Animation with USD — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"An Automation Pipeline for Robotics and Animation with USD" by Lars Beier, Vitus Pacholleck, Julius Schöps at Blender Conference 2025

In this presentation, Lars Beier, Vitus Pacholleck, and Julius Schöps share how they use Blender as the cornerstone of a 3D pipeline for robotics onboarding, simulation, and animation. They demonstrate how Blender supports automation across multiple workflow stages: from asset preparation and rigging to procedural animation, while integrating with OpenUSD-based platforms. The speakers will highlight practical use cases from industrial pipelines, showcasing both strengths and limitations. Their session illustrates how Blender enables collaboration between engineers and creatives, and why it is an essential tool for connecting robotics simulation with streamlined animation workflows in professional environments.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: VFX workflows for Sonic the Hedgehog 3 — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"VFX workflows for Sonic the Hedgehog 3" by Joel Prager at Blender Conference 2025

A walkthrough of how Blender was used as a core part of the VFX pipeline on Sonic The Hedgehog 3. I’ll cover how we integrated Blender into Paramount’s in-house pipeline, from previs through postviz to final shots.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Light my shiny render pass! — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Light my shiny render pass!" by Yaraslau Lebedzeu at Blender Conference 2025

Rendering relies heavily on approximations of physical reality, which can sometimes fail to capture complex optical effects. This is one reason why 3D renders don't always appear true to life. Yaraslau will explore phenomena such as birefringence, gradient index of refraction, diffraction, and the challenges of spectral rendering—topics that go beyond the limits of the RGB color model. He will also discuss when simplified models fall short and what Blender’s Cycles renderer can accurately mimic.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Designing in a 3D Playground: Unlocking Low-Code Add-on Development for Engineers — BCon 2025
snippet.description:
"Designing in a 3D Playground: Unlocking Low-Code Add-on Development for Engineers" by Seán Carroll at Blender Conference 2025

This talk explores how engineers can create domain-specific tools in Blender using the low-code development add-on Serpens and powerful Python libraries such as OpenSeesPy. The presentation highlights StructureWorks, a structural analysis add-on that brings finite element simulation into Blender’s 3D environment. By combining node-based visual scripting with external Python tools, engineers can now prototype and deploy custom workflows with minimal coding. This session demonstrates how Blender offers an accessible and highly visual alternative to traditional engineering software, aiming to inspire the AEC community and others to consider Blender as a platform for building tailored, professional-grade tools.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: A million little curves: creating hair for animals — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"A million little curves: creating hair for animals" by Kerstin Schmidbauer at Blender Conference 2025

Have you ever tried to create a full-character hair groom? Did it look broken, with bald spots or just wrong? Were you frustrated because the hair curves seemed to move at their own will? 

No longer! It's time to tame the wild hair strands. From hair length to density, realistic to cartoony, we will look at how to create a full-body hair groom with Blender's curve hair system. Going through the entire workflow from concept to materials, while also looking at common pitfalls and how to avoid them during the process.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Making a spectrogram with Geometry Nodes — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Making a spectrogram with Geometry Nodes" by Simon HENRY at Blender Conference 2025

Hearing sound is fun, but being able to see it is even cooler ! From technical challenges to UI accessibility, follow a 3 year journey on how geonodes and python made it possible to create a 3D spectrogram in Blender.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: From Pen Plotters to Robots: Geometry Nodes for Parametric Toolpathing — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"From Pen Plotters to Robots: Geometry Nodes for Parametric Toolpathing" by Luis Pacheco at Blender Conference 2025

In this talk, Luis Arturo Pacheco demonstrates how Geometry Nodes can be used to design parametric toolpaths for a range of machines, from pen plotters, laser cutters, and 3D printers to industrial robots. He introduces Animaquina, an open-source addon that brings Robot motion design, simulation, and real-world control into Blender. Attendees will discover how procedural workflows can streamline the process of generating custom toolpaths, enabling artists, designers, and makers to bridge the gap between digital creation and physical fabrication.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Smart Interoperability: Integrating Photogrammetry-Based Heritage Models in Blender — BCon 2025
snippet.description:
"Smart Interoperability: Integrating Photogrammetry-Based Heritage Models in Blender for Rural Digital Transformation" by Gianluca Emilio Ennio Vita at Blender Conference 2025

This presentation explores how Blender is being used within the digitalization strategy of Territorio Mudéjar—a network of rural municipalities in Spain—to integrate 3D photogrammetric models of Mudejar heritage into open, interoperable systems for education, conservation, and public engagement. By aligning with the FAIR principles and Europeana standards, we demonstrate how Blender supports high-quality rendering, annotation, and reusability of digital assets while addressing rural challenges like limited technical capacity and proprietary barriers.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Empowering Game Development: A Studio-Wide Integration at Behaviour Interactive — BCon 2025
snippet.description:
"Empowering Game Development: A Studio-Wide Integration at Behaviour Interactive" by Michael Penta, Nicolas Leclerc at Blender Conference 2025

This presentation delves into how Behaviour Interactive strategically incorporated Blender into its development pipeline, and the transformative effects this integration has had on workflow, collaboration, and studio culture.  

We will explore the decision-making process that led to Blender’s integration as a production tool — examining both the technical and cultural considerations. Key motivators included Blender’s flexibility and the increasing maturity of its toolset, particularly in modeling, animation, and rigging. These capabilities allowed the studio to meet specific production needs while fostering greater creative freedom.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Making a music video in geometry nodes for OK Go — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Making a music video in geometry nodes for OK Go" by Will Anderson at Blender Conference 2025

Impluse Purchase - An OK Go and Blender Studio Production

In collaboration with Italian designer and artist Lucas Zanotto, OK Go, and Blender Studio, we created a music video built almost entirely using Blender’s procedural workflow—Geometry Nodes. Over three months, we developed a system that not only drives complex visuals but also supports real-time interactivity through OSC inputs, including facial motion capture and external controls. The result is both a visually rich music video and an interactive project that blurs the line between animation and performance, showcasing Blender’s potential as a live visual tool.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: A glimpse into "Flow" — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"A glimpse into "Flow"" by Martins Upitis, Konstantins Visnevskis at Blender Conference 2025

"Flow" is a feature-length animated film directed by Gints Zilbalodis, created entirely in Blender and rendered in real-time using Eevee.
In this session, technical artists Konstantīns and Mārtiņš will take you behind the scenes of the production, offering insights into the studio’s workflow and the creative and technical challenges they faced along the way.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: import bpy: modern add-on development — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"import bpy: modern add-on development" by dr. Sybren A. Stüvel at Blender Conference 2025

The basics of building an add-on, from copy-pasting code from Blender's UI to connecting a debugger and stepping through your Python code.

Bring your laptop! We’re going to code together. Which means you’ll code and I’ll be there for moral support.

Check https://talks.stuvel.eu/2025-09-bcon/ for the slides, you can copy-paste code from there to save typing. And there's a list of software to install, so that we can hit the ground running.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Love, Death, Robots and a little of Blender — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Love, Death, Robots and a little of Blender" by Ruben Sotomayor Criado, Renato Roldan at Blender Conference 2025

In this talk, Rubén Sotomayor and Renato Roldán share how Blender was used in the preproduction of "How Zeke Got Religion", an episode from the latest season of Love, Death & Robots (Netflix). They will showcase how Blender enabled the creation of 3D busts and scene elements that served as stylized reference for the 2D animation and how it enhanced the workflow for the storyboard.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Building with the Piggy Builders — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Building with the Piggy Builders" by Tanguy Weyland at Blender Conference 2025

Exclusive behind-the-scenes look at Piggy Builders, the new CGI animated series from Xilam and created by Cube Creative. This presentation will offer a full creative and technical breakdown of the production process. From concept development and visual design to animation techniques and final rendering.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: II Baracchino - Donuts don't die in vain — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"II Baracchino - Donuts don't die in vain" by Andrea Cigognetti, Nicolò Cuccì at Blender Conference 2025

Il Baracchino is a wild mixed-media animated series about Stand-up comedy, big dreams and disillusioned antropomorphic unicorns. 

Animated by Megadrago and produced by Prime video and Lucky Red, the series was born from a garage-style dream and was brought to life using Blender’s magic. 

The creator/director and the Head of CG of the series will dive into the creative risks, clever problem-solving, and the blender-fueled madness behind the scenes of a indie mini-series about the relentless pursuit of making something great against all odds.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: The Optimization Iceberg - Making 3D run on any device — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"The Optimization Iceberg - Making 3D run on any device" by David Deckert at Blender Conference 2025

Mobile Devices can handle large 3D scenes very well, when they are prepared properly. The talk will show how Blender, the glTF/glb format and BabylonJS work together to create big and interactive scenes that run smoothly on a wide range of devices without the need of any third-party software or pixel streaming. Whether you are building Product showcases, interactive experiences or architectural walkthroughs. Making it available for everyone is the key and we have open-source tools for that.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: From Flat to Feeling: How Stylized Shading Shapes Narrative — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"From Flat to Feeling: How Stylized Shading Shapes Narrative" by Lee Cui at Blender Conference 2025

This talk will explore how stylized shading can serve as a powerful storytelling tool. Drawing from the making of her independent animated short Mirror, Lee will present a comparative analysis of toon-shading techniques and their role in shaping narrative tone. The session aim to highlight how artists can harness Blender’s toon shaders, lighting, and color to evoke emotion and atmosphere, offering both inspiration and practical insight into the expressive potential of non-photorealistic rendering, especially when working with a limited budget.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: I’m a Complete Hack - But This is how simple techniques still make a big … — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"I’m a Complete Hack - But This is how simple techniques still make a big impact." by Martin Sweers at Blender Conference 2025

You don’t need to be a technical expert to create high-end 3D work. I’m living proof of that, since I fully consider myself a hack when it comes to the technical side of Blender. What I do have is a clear vision, a strong sense of what works visually, and a community of talented people who help me handle the complex parts. This talk shares how the Blender community welcomed me, and how that generosity became the foundation for Not Important Studio and its community-driven approach to creative production.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: "Trophy Son": The (Not So) Easy Journey of an Animated Short — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
""Trophy Son": The (Not So) Easy Journey of an Animated Short" by Maor fridman at Blender Conference 2025

'Trophy Son', our short animated film made entirely in Blender, has been a year-long passion project. We, at Fridaylab, are excited to share our journey with you! We'll cover everything from kicking off ideas to building custom Geometry Node tools and crafting the film's unique flat 3D character style. Get a real peek into how we make stuff for the love of it, and stick around for a sneak peek of 'Trophy Son's' latest animation!

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Slot it like it's hot: progress on the new animation system — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Slot it like it's hot: progress on the new animation system" by dr. Sybren A. Stüvel at Blender Conference 2025

Progress report of the Animation & Rigging module, and presentation of plans for the coming year.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Nissan 500sx: A Retro-Futuristic Concept Car — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Nissan 500sx: A Retro-Futuristic Concept Car" by Valentin Komkov at Blender Conference 2025

What if Nissan revived the spirit of ’90s Japanese sport coupes — but reimagined for the electric era? In this talk, I’ll walk through the creation of the Nissan 500sx, a fully original concept car designed, modeled, and animated from scratch using Blender.

From early sketches to final renders, I’ll show how Blender can be a complete design lab for automotive storytelling. This session explores design thinking, hard-surface workflows, shading and lighting for realism, and how to build an emotional narrative around a fictional product. Whether you’re into cars, cinematic rendering, or pure creativity — this is a love letter to what Blender makes possible.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Blender at Volkswagen Group — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Blender at Volkswagen Group" by Ali Varol, Alina Schubert at Blender Conference 2025

This presentation is about how Blender is currently used within the Volkswagen Group and where we see its future potential. We address specific challenges in applying Blender to technical workflows in comparison to other applications and present a custom-developed add-on for Diagnostic Shading as a targeted solution.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Microscopy Nodes: handling large biological volumes — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Microscopy Nodes: handling large biological volumes" by Aafke Gros at Blender Conference 2025

Microscopy gives us a window into the hidden world of cells and molecules, but visualizing this data remains a major challenge. To bridge this gap, we present Microscopy Nodes, a Blender extension opening Blender up for a new user base of microscopists.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Mapping Pipelines: Lessons from Three Open Source Studios — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Mapping Pipelines: Lessons from Three Open Source Studios" by Swann Martinez, Rémy Sohier at Blender Conference 2025

How do production studios using Blender structure their pipelines—and how open can they really be? This talk presents findings from the Paneurama project, based on interviews with three French studios (Cube Creative, Autour de Minuit, and Normaal) that place Blender and open-source principles at the heart of their workflows. We share comparative maps of their dataflows, toolchains, and IT infrastructures, highlighting major differences despite shared tools. This presentation invites the Blender community to help expand this collective mapping effort and foster a culture of transparency and collaboration.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: Reimagining Iconic Anime Backgrounds in 3D — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"Reimagining Iconic Anime Backgrounds in 3D" by Mike Yakovlev at Blender Conference 2025

In recent years, I've explored unique and accessible ways to translate iconic anime backgrounds into 3D. Unlike traditional anime workflows using Blender, this approach doesn't rely on Grease Pencil, shader tricks, or hand-drawn effects. Instead, I reimagine the aesthetic through purely 3D techniques using creative workarounds within Eevee's limits. In this talk, I will share how I recreated Akira's iconic backgrounds, lessons learned, and my future goals.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25

snippet.title: The Sculpting, Modeling and Node tools - key players in the game art pipe — Blender Conference 2025
snippet.description:
"The Sculpting, Modeling and Node tools - key players in the game art pipeline" by Leonardo Betancur Díaz at Blender Conference 2025

This talk is designed to showcase how Blender’s sculpting, modeling and other integrated tools can be effectively used for game asset creation, with a strong focus on Environment, Prop art and character  concepting. Based on  four years of experience as a professional 3D artist (https://www.artstation.com/beta3dart) in game development, Leonardo will present practical examples to demonstrate how Blender fits into game art production pipelines. Also Leonardo will address common misconceptions about Blender’s limitations, and provide concrete, examples that highlight its strengths and relevance in modern game art workflows.

–

Learn more about Blender Conference 2025 at https://conference.blender.org/2025/

#b3d #BCON25
